title: Five injured after rockets fired at Kabul airport
description:
(27 Sep 2017) At least five civilians were wounded when several rockets were fired toward Kabul international airport in the Afghan capital, officials said Wednesday.
The attack that came as US Secretary of Defense James Mattis and NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg were in town for a visit.
Najib Danish, spokesman for the Afghan Interior Ministry, said one rocket stuck a home near the airport, wounding the five victims. 
He said one victim was a woman who was "not in a good health condition".
Zabihullah Mujahid, a Taliban spokesman, claimed responsibility for the attack on his official Twitter account.
Danish said Afghan security forces surrounded an area where where they suspected the rockets might have been fired.
Tumor Shah Hamedi, director of Kabul airport, said all flights were halted as result of the attack.
A doctor at the Wazir Akbar Khan hospital said they had received four wounded people including two children.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/7f5b63994b769c7d3b1da61c9d6d758a
